ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Social and Behavioral Determinants of Health (SBDH) category
Start position of the keyword in the discharge summary
End position of the keyword in the discharge summary
Discharge summary - SDOH Community Present
Notes: 0=False, passages related to active social support not found in discharge summary; 1=True, passages related to active social support found in discharge summary

ElementDescription: Discharge summary - SDOH Community Absent
Notes: 0=False, passages related to loss of social support not found in discharge summary; 1=True, passages related to loss of social support found in discharge summary

ElementDescription: Discharge summary - SDOH Education
Notes: 0=False, passages related to subject education not found in discharge summary; 1=True, passages related to subject education found in discharge summary

ElementDescription: Discharge summary - SDOH Economics
Notes: 0=None, passages related to subject employment not found in discharge summary; 1=True, subject is currently employed; 2=False, subject is unemployed (including retirement)

ElementDescription: Discharge summary - SDOH Environment
Notes: 0=None, passages related to subject housing not found in discharge summary; 1=True, any indication of subject housing; 2=False, subject is homeless

ElementDescription: Discharge summary - Behavioral Alcohol
Notes: 0=None, passages related to alcohol consumption not found in discharge summary; 1=Present, subject is a current consumer of alcohol; 2=Past, subject was a consumer of alcohol and has quit; 3=Never, the subject has never consumed alcohol; 4=Unsure, discharge summary had an ambiguous passage related to alcohol consumption

ElementDescription: Discharge summary - Behavioral Tobacco
Notes: 0=None, passages related to tobacco consumption not found in discharge summary; 1=Present, subject is a current consumer of tobacco; 2=Past, subject was a consumer of tobacco and has quit; 3=Never, the subject has never consumed tobacco; 4=Unsure, discharge summary had an ambiguous passage related to tobacco consumption

ElementDescription: Discharge summary - Behavioral Drug
Notes: 0=None, passages related to drug consumption not found in discharge summary; 1=Present, subject is a current consumer of drugs; 2=Past, subject was a consumer of drugs and has quit; 3=Never, the subject has never consumed drugs; 4=Unsure, discharge summary had an ambiguous passage related to drug consumption

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Within the past 3 months, did you ever eat less than you felt you should because there wasn't enough money for food?
In the past 3 months, have you been living in stable housing that you own, rent, or stay in as part of a household?
Are you worried or concerned that in the next 3 months you may NOT have stable housing that you own, rent, or stay in as part of a household?
Within the past 3 months, has lack of transportation kept you from doctors? appointments or from getting your medications?
During the past 3 months, was there a time that you were not working and looking for work?
Over the past 3 months, were you involved in any new legal issues, or were you on parole or probation?
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Month of the interview
Within the past 12 months, you worried that your food would run out before you got money to buy more.
Within the past 12 months, the food you bought just didn''t last and you didn''t have money to get more.
In the past 12 months, has lack of reliable transportation kept you from medical appointments, meetings, work or from getting things needed for daily living?
How hard is it for you to pay for the very basics like food, housing, medical care, and heating? Would you say it is:
If for any reason you need help with day-to-day activities such as bathing, preparing meals, shopping, managing finances, etc., do you get the help you need?
Notes: 1=I don't need any help; 2=I get all the help I need; 3=I could use a little more help;  4=I need a lot more help

ElementDescription: How often do you feel lonely or isolated from those around you?
